content:
You're in the heart of Japan! Tokyo has plenty of amazing tonkatsu restaurants to choose from. Here are some highly-recommended, casual, and mid-range options for you to try:

1. **Tonkatsu Maisen Aoyama Honten** (, 3-13-3 Minami-Aoyama, Minato-ku) - A popular chain with multiple locations, but this one is the original. Their tonkatsu is crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, and served with shredded cabbage, rice, and miso soup. (~ ¥1,500 - ¥2,500 per person)
2. **Tonkatsu Takeshin** (, 2-14-3 Yoyogi, Shibuya-ku) - A small, family-run restaurant with a cozy atmosphere. Their tonkatsu is made with high-quality pork and served with a side of rice, miso soup, and a small salad. (~ ¥1,500 - ¥2,500 per person)
3. **Katsu-Ya** (, 3-2-14 Shinjuku, Shinjuku-ku) - A casual, no-frills restaurant with a wide variety of tonkatsu options, including some unique flavors like curry and mentaiko (spicy pollock roe). (~ ¥1,000 - ¥2,000 per person)
4. **Tonkatsu Tanaka** (, 1-1-2 Nihonbashi, Chuo-ku) - A small, retro-style restaurant with a focus on high-quality ingredients. Their tonkatsu is crispy and flavorful, served with rice, miso soup, and a side of pickles. (~ ¥1,500 - ¥2,500 per person)
5. **Tonkatsu Tofuya Ukai** (, 2-14-3 Nihonbashi, Chuo-ku) - A tofu specialty restaurant that also serves excellent tonkatsu. Their tonkatsu is made with premium pork and served with a side of tofu and rice. (~ ¥1,500 - ¥2,500 per person)

These restaurants are all relatively affordable and offer a delicious tonkatsu experience. Enjoy your meal!
